page.title: 07BIOGRAPHY
page.content: A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A NUN. Sister Clare-Marie would get up at 5.30am,have a wash,get dressed,then go to Morning Offering Prayers,followed by Mass.She would then have breakfast which is coffee and bread,stood up.The Second Offering Prayers follow consisting of 3 songs,a reding and bidding prayers.Then work commences,such as weeding the garden or sewing or making altarbreads.At midday they pray for relatives and friends.At 1.30pm lunch of vegetable soup and potatoes is eaten.After washing up she has some free time.At 3.30 they pray again.Dinner is at 6pm and consists of vegetables and cheese or fish but no meat.All nuns retire to bed at 9pm after evening prayers but get up again at 11.45 to pray until 1.15am wnen their long day is over.
